Author: dan.#2473
Content: Supernet has always been interesting to me, i was also in at ICO. but i opted out and parked myself in komodo instead when mm1.0 was at its peak. the 5 percent reward and (in my opinion) gains will be larger with kmd itself. and, the illiquidity was worrisome. if there was a CC way for supernet to auto-buy and auto-sell holdings on bdex like an ETF, it could trade near NAV and be fully liquid. Though, as KMD is the base to get Supernet, there's a myriad of problems with this, such as being able to auto-buy-sell WAVES or auto-buy-sell illiquid holdings like some assetchains.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
btc has ~270k tx per day [1]
kmd -> btc notarization is ~150 per day [2]

[1] https://www.blockchain.com/en/charts/n-transactions
[2] https://www.blocktrail.com/BTC/address/1P3rU1Nk1pmc2BiWC8dEy9bZa1ZbMp5jfg/transactions

150/270000 = 1/20 of 1% or 0.05%

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
in "nomal" raw tx scriptPubKey:
```
0x19 = OP_DUP
0x76 = OP_HASH160
0x88 = OP_EQUALVERIFY
0xac = OP_CHECKSIG
```
in "pubkey" raw tx (in the same location as OP_DUP OP_HASH160 "would be"):
```
0x23 = ?
0x21 = ?
```
I can't seem to find this documented anywhere (but it's not the most search-friendly set of terms, anyway)

Author: Tobias Nunes#4493
Content: is there any chance a compromised (50%+ attack) block makes it into the BTC Chain via the dPoW mechanism, if the attack is not recognized within the 10 minute timeframe?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what does that even mean?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a block is valid or invalid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is invalid, it isnt valid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is valid, it is valid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only valid blocks are notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in other words, notarizations allows to differentiate between two valid blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is no need to differentiate invalid blocks as invalid blocks are not valid

Author: Tobias Nunes#4493
Content: so any manipulated blocks cannot pass the validation process and be notarized into the BTC blockchain?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: block validation is a work of miners
